channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights completely obscured by trees, 5th June
item.description:
The traffic lights on the A40 where it meets the A436 at Shipton Olliffe. Specifically the lights on the A40 as you approach from cheltenham The lights cannot be seen until you are within a few meters of the junction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold

item.title: 20 inch pothole in layby on A435, 4th June
item.description:
The pothole is on the left hand side of the layby that sits southbound just past the junction with the B4079. It is a short way from the entrance to the layby. I do not know how long it has been there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation obstructing complete view of chicane., 4th June
item.description:
The traffic calming chicane on Gotherington lane. Whilst the vegetation has been cleared from one entry into the chicane, visibility from the other end is obscured by long grass and presents a risk to all road traffic. The vegetation is a very obvious risk from all points in this chicane and it needs to be regularly cleared before an accident occurs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trench filling is moving under load, 4th June
item.description:
There are 2 trenches in this road that have been filled. However heavey lorries are making the filling move leaving deep potholes. The trench needs digging out and the correct grade tarmac refilling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic calming on Gotherington lane is dangerous, 4th June
item.description:
The Traffic calming on Gotherington lane is dangerous as the verges are not maintained on a monthly basis. It is not easy to see oncoming traffic....particularly if the vehicle is not tall. Seeing cyclists is also an issue. Please remove the traffic calming ASAP. It would be far safer to have just a speed camera. Thereby limiting speed, maintaining traffic flow and causing less pollution due to unecessary stop start.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree, 4th June
item.description:
I am writing to express my deep concern regarding a serious and ongoing issue I first reported on 13th June 2022 regarding a tree growing dangerously close to my roof. This poses an imminent danger to my family, especially during adverse weather conditions. Following my initial report, I received a response from Dorothy Coopey confirming that the work had been programmed to take place, under reference number 11368736. I followed up via email on 28th October 2022, but did not receive any reply. On 20th December 2023, I was informed by Dawn Hanker that a new work order had been raised under reference number 43087666. However, to date, no action has been taken, and the tree continues to grow, increasing the risk to my family. This delay of nearly three years is unacceptable, especially given that the danger was acknowledged and scheduled for action in 2022. The situation is now severely impacting my children's mental health and education â€” they cannot study or sleep peacefully, and are often forced to sleep in the conservatory during strong winds due to fear of the tree falling. I urge you to treat this matter with the urgency it deserves. If no action is taken promptly, I will be compelled to take legal action against the Highway Authority for negligence and the potential harm to my family's well-being. Please confirm the issuance of an immediate work order and the expected date for the work to be completed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Limber Hill, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposter - gardening competition on lampposts, 4th June
item.description:
Same person has put another two flyposters up on two lampposts at the junction between Pilley Lane, Old Bath Road and Everest Road. One is on the lamppost on Everest Rd as you enter the estate, the other is at the junction of Old bath Rd and Pilley Lane on left side as you start to go down Pilley Lane.

item.title: Footbridge has been vandalised, 4th June
item.description:
It appears that someone has tried to destroy the footbridge. They have lit a fire on the bridge in what appears to be an attempt to destroy it. They have also broken the wooden spar at the front of the bridge and broken down the way marker post and thrown them in the stream. Without attention this bridge could become quite dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Bark Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip in the Pylons Car Park at the end of Cleeve Common Road, 4th June
item.description:
The location is the Pylons Car Park at the end of Cleeve Common Road - The material - mainly wood panels is on the right hand side near the Dog Bag Bin and over the edge of the location (see first photograph). It has been there for some time - please can it be cleared up together with a rubbish pick for the whole carpark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Path, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
